lines.text: [Bob Dennis is practicing aiming and firing his gun]
You're sure itchin' to use that thing again, ain't ya?
You're always ready. Put it away.
Yeah, well, I wouldn't be if it wasn't for you.
I'm sick of these two-bit towns. What's wrong with a place like Abilene for instance?
Everything, as far as we're concerned.
They're bound to have a lot of cash on hand. They've got to pay off the trail drives.
That's just it. Where's there's a lot of cash, there's a lot of guns.
That's why we're alive. And we'll stay that way as long as we stick to the small towns.
Jack Wright? For some reason or other that name sounds familiar.
Yeah, it should. I'm the local hero.
You're looking at the man who shot the notorious Alvin Dennis from a distance of half a mile... with a slingshot.

I'm going to get him. I'm going to get him if it's the last thing I do. And he's mine. No matter what happens, he's mine... do you understand? All you have to do is cover me. And we're not leavin' that town till that storekeeper's guts have been shot out.
